title: Forge Splattershot Pro
paragraphs: The Forge Splattershot Pro is a main weapon in the Splatoon series. It is a Forge-branded variant of the Splattershot Pro.

The Forge Splattershot Pro shares its overall design with the Splattershot Pro. However, the Forge Splattershot Pro's trigger piece, pyramid, and nozzle tip are white, and the tube, handhold, and the piece next to the pyramid are black. The nozzle is orange and bears the Forge logo. The trigger is also orange.

Nearly identical to the Splattershot Pro, the Forge Splattershot Pro is an advanced weapon in terms of power and fire rate, making it easy to use for more experienced players. It comes in a set with the Point Sensor and Inkzooka.

The Forge Splattershot Pro was released on 2 September 2017 at 02:00 UTC.[2]
The Forge Splattershot Pro makes use of the same main weapon as Splattershot Pro: it is a long-range, high damage shooter with high ink consumption. It comes with the Suction Bomb and Bubble Blower.

For competitive tips about the Forge Splattershot Pro
- In Splatoon 2, the Forge Splattershot Pro was the first weapon to debut the Bubble Blower special weapon.
- The Forge Splattershot Pro is the only weapon released by Forge.
- Across all three games, the Forge Splattershot Pro is unlocked at level 20. It is the latest-unlocked weapon to have this property.

Forge Splattershot Pro is a combination of Splatter (as well as Splat), Shot and the shortened form of Professional. It has the Forge brand name as a prefix to differentiate it from the Splattershot Pro. It also denotes that the weapon is a collaboration with Forge.

Its Japanese name, プライムシューターコラボ puraimu shūtā korabo, means "Prime Shooter Collab". The abbreviated suffix Collab denotes it is a collaboration. However, unlike the English name, it doesn't specify the brand Forge.
